data:
Persuader: Hello there! Have you heard of the international organization Save the Children?
	Persuadee: Hi.  It sounds familiar but I'm not sure.
Persuader: Save the Children is a non-governmental organizaton that promotes children's rights, provides relief, and helps support children in developing countries. It's a great organization!
	Persuadee: Is it reputable?
Persuader: Certainly! I do volunteer work that supports the organization, actually. And if you'd like to check out the website, you can go to  URL 
	Persuadee: It looks like they do great work.  Let's make a donation.
Persuader: Sounds great, your generosity will go great lengths! How much would you like to donate to the organization? Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment and you can choose any amount from $0 to all of your payment.
	Persuadee: I'll donate half my payment, so $.15.
Persuader: Wonderful! The research team will collect all donations and send them directly to Save the Children.
	Persuadee: Sounds good.  Out of curiosity, what did you do as a volunteer?
Persuader: Pack educational materials/books to send to children with limited access to such resources
	Persuadee: That's interesting.  I might want to volunteer too.
Persuader: It's a very rewarding experience. A productive activity to fill your free time with. :)
	Persuadee: It doesn't seem fair that some kids are born into bad situations through no fault of their own.
Persuader: Certainly. The good thing is, however, that there are many organizations that we can support that help push for and ensure the rights of children and that they are given opportunities to succeed.
	Persuadee: Thanks for telling me about it.
Persuader: You are welcome! Thank you for your kind donation.
	Persuadee: It's not much, but I don't have much money.  Of course I have no way of knowing no matter what you answer, but are you a real person?
Persuader: Small changes lead to big results. ;) and haha! Yes, I am. :)
	Persuadee: Good luck to you!  I hope you get lots of donations.

data:
Persuader: Hello, how are you today?
	Persuadee: I'm good.  What Children's charity would you like to donate money to?
Persuader: I like to donate, but i have a soft heart for children too. I recently read about "Save the Children" and red more about it.
	Persuadee: Save the Children sounds like a good charity to me as well.
Persuader: Yes I like how they are clear about their financial reports and They are a big organization 
	Persuadee: Clear financial reports are a very good thing.  They work with children all around the world. Correct?
Persuader: Yes they work in 120 different countries, on different issues.
	Persuadee: Wow, that's amazing.  Definitely a charity that I could stand behind and support.
Persuader: Same here, they have many option to help, We can donate or We can participate in their events
	Persuadee: I don't know much about their events.  But I have money that I can donate.
Persuader: I usually like to help financially too, since I do not have many off days to join event. Some of their members even travel to different countries to help in person. I believe that is a big thing to do
	Persuadee: I wouldn't have the time off to do that.  But that's pretty cool what they do.
Persuader: Yes, they are also connected to big companies like IKEA and Walt Disney. I would like to see part of my purchase will be donated
	Persuadee: Donating part of a purchase is such an easy way for a large amount of people to donate money.
Persuader: Exactly, I also like how there are HITs which encourage you to donate. It makes me happy to donate part or all of my bonus
	Persuadee: If it's a charity I believe in that's a great way.  I donate to many local charities in my city.
Persuader: that is so nice of you. like "Save the Children" has many options to donate. You can directly donate through website, It has a minimum amount, but you can also donate part of the HIT reward at the end of the conversation, It can be 0 or 1 cent or any other amount
	Persuadee: I think I'll probably donate at the end of this conversation.  Will you be doing so as well?
Persuader: I sure will. I did it in the past. and surprisingly my reward did not even change
	Persuadee: I've had similar things happen.  I'm glad we good agree on a charity to donate to.

Persuader: i help with everything they say to me, now im helping finding people donating, thank you for the donation today, god bless you.
	Persuadee: Thank you very much. I will happily donate 60 cents.

data:
Persuader: What do you think of children?
	Persuadee: I think they are the future of the world and in general, I like them.
Persuader: I agree. What would you think of donating to Save The Children, a charity organization dedicated to helping children in poor third-world countries have a brighter future?
	Persuadee: I think we have bigger problems to solve than helping children in poor third-world countries, and if I decide to donate money it would be to a different organization
Persuader: That's a shame. I always donate 10% of my income to charities. Why don't you want to help starving children?
	Persuadee: because I prefer to donate money to organizations attacking bigger problems, it's just a matter of priorities
Persuader: Some of these children haven't eaten for days. They're skin and bones. What could be more important than basic human decency?
	Persuadee: There are a lot of problems more important than feeding kids. Cancer research for example, water or basic health in poor countries. Basic human decency is not just food.
Persuader: None of those things matter to children who are dying right now of hunger. They won't be alive to enjoy those benefits if we don't take care of them now.
	Persuadee: If you think that way then you have never seen sickness and people suffering from easily treated health problems. I've seen cancer way too close to me to make me believe that's way more important to solve than feeding kids in another country.
Persuader: You won't even donate $1? That's half of what you'll be making from this study alone. You wouldn't even notice it's absece
	Persuadee: I would donate and I donated every year way more than that but to organizations attacking problems that I think should be solved first
Persuader: And how much money do you spend on luxuries like coffee, soda, fast food, etc? You really think that money couldn't be better used in Syria?
	Persuadee: I think you got the wrong person, I don't spend money on luxuries because I have not enough money to be able to do that. I cook my own food and I don't drink coffee or soda, and I still donate money to help causes I believe should be solved. I do believe that money could be used better than sending it to Syria
Persuader: That's short-sighted. Solving cancer or repairing infrastructure won't matter to the millions that die from lack of food.
	Persuadee: You are the one short-sighted. I didn't say anything about repairing infrastructure, and yes, solving cancer would be way better used money than sending it to Syria.
Persuader: You said water. That's infrastructure. Do you even know what you're talking about?
	Persuadee: No, you are wrong, water is not infrastructure, you should read a little bit before you say something liked that
Persuader: lol google it if you don't believe me:  URL 
	Persuadee: First, 'lol' shouldn't be in a serious conversation, and second, It's not just that you are wrong, I actually support an organization providing clean water access to people, and helping with that problem it's not just a matter of infrastructure

Persuader: Hello, how are you this evening/morning?
	Persuadee: I am good thanks, how are you?
Persuader: I am good, have you ever heard about the organization "Save the Children"?
	Persuadee: Yes but I do not know that much about it

	Persuadee: Yes I have made donations to help sick children

	Persuadee: I have helped children outside my country in the past. I believe donations of any amount help make a difference 
Persuader: You sound like a very generous person. I have personal history as my husband was a refugee as a child. We have a blended family. It just makes me sad that children have to suffer no matter where they are. Save the children is a great organization. Would you consider a donation to them?
	Persuadee: Yes I agree and I would consider a donation to them
Persuader: That is really great, this organization also helps with children's rights to health, education, safety, and much more. Your donation would make a tangible impact no matter the amount. 
	Persuadee: At this time I would like to donate $2.00
Persuader: That would be wonderful, are you interested in their website?
	Persuadee: Yes that would be great
Persuader: Here is their website:   URL 
	Persuadee: Ok I will check it out now thank you have a good night
Persuader: Before you go please a few more questions, just to clarify you are willing to donate $2 of your bonus to this organization?
	Persuadee: Yes I am
Persuader: Thank you for your donation. Please be ensured that the researcher will collect all donations and send it directly to the organization.
	Persuadee: Ok thank you for your help and information 
Persuader: Thank you have a wonderful day, it was nice to chat with you.
	Persuadee: You as well

data:
Persuader: Hi, how are you today?
	Persuadee: i'm good. how are you? are you ready for your 3 day weekend?
Persuader: I'm good, I'm never ready when I should be , haha
	Persuadee: luckily i don't have to really do much, so what brings you here today?
Persuader: Well, how do you feel about charity's like Save the Children? Do you donate often?
	Persuadee: I haven't donated to them but i'm sympathetic to their cause
Persuader: Would you ever consider donating?
	Persuadee: Do you know what the donations go to? i'm not very well versed on the details 
Persuader: Sure, they go to many things well, revolving around children anyway. Some of their funding goes to the refugee children who are going hungry, without education, and medical help. They go to children who have been through natural disasters to help them and their families rebuild the communities like the most recent hurrican in Texas. They also fund programs for inner city kids to have a safe haven while continuing their education.
	Persuadee: are you a supporter / donor?
Persuader: Yes, I've donated reguarly, most of the time I wish I could do more but even the smallest amounts help.... even pennies add up if there's enough ::)
	Persuadee: i would think about donating something at some point. 
Persuader: Well, today the research team are giving all of us the oppurtunity to donate some of our bonus money if we are interested in doing so....  
	Persuadee: how much have you donated today? or intend to donate today?
Persuader: I'm going to donate $.25 of mine like I said it's not much but something is better then nothing at least that's what I've been told since I was a kid :)
	Persuadee: can you tell me anything else about save the children?
Persuader: Well, they're a international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries. And all of the donations they recieve go towards the children unlike other charities who only donate a portion.
	Persuadee: okay, id be willing to donate 30 cents to them. 
Persuader: See, $.25 has now turned in $.55 almost the price of a candy bar ;)
	Persuadee: thats true, :) if only everyone else did it too, that 55 cents would go really far

data:
Persuader: Hi, my name is Maria, How are you?
	Persuadee: Hi Maria. I'm doing fine, thanks! :)
Persuader: So I just got involved with this charity called Save the Children. I don't know if you remember the actress Sally Struthers from All in the Family, but she used to promote it. Anyway, they are really involved in helping the children in Syria.
	Persuadee: Oh nice. What kind of work do they do with children?
Persuader: They go into places where many other agencies won't go...war torn nations like Somalia, Venezuela and Syria. They specifically concentrate on helping children, who really are innocent and can't fend for themselves. Many of them are orphans.
	Persuadee: That sounds like a pretty good cause. Are they a non-profit? Do you know how they are funded?
Persuader: Yes they are definitely non-profit. They get donations from big donors like corporations, but a lot of their funding comes from people like you and me who give smaller amounts. Any little bit helps. When you consider that workers in many countries make $3.00 a day, just 50 cents can make a huge difference in the life of a child.
	Persuadee: That's true. Every little bit counts, I suppose.
Persuader: I usually am one who supports animal welfare charities and environmental charities, but Save the Children is one of the few children's charities that I really have a lot of respect for. I am going to donate some of my task money. I was wondering if you would be interested in doing the same. It doesn't have to be a lot...just what you feel moved to donate. Any bit makes a difference.
	Persuadee: Oh i'm a big animal lover too! I'd definitely be interested in donating, but can I ask a few questions first?
Persuader: Sure! I'll answer as best as I can.
	Persuadee: Awesome. Do you know how much of our donations go directly to help the children? Sorry, to ask but I've contributed to a few that were less than open about it...
Persuader: charity navigator says 88.3% which is in line with similar charities that do the same thing
	Persuadee: Oh, that's actually pretty good. I understand there always has to be room for admin costs and outreach. Also, do you know how we actually make a donation?
Persuader: Yes. The team will monitor this conversation, and once I ask you what you want to give, they will take care of it. Being that this is mechanical turk and that it is an academic survey, I believe they are trustworthy and will get the money to the charity. So....if you have decided to donate, how much would you like to donate?
	Persuadee: Okay, sounds good. Is there a limit to what we can donate? I think we only get $0.30 for this HIT, so can I donate all or part of that?
Persuader: You can donate anywhere from 0 to 30 cents. The decision is yours. And thank you for whatever you decide to give. 
	Persuadee: Okay, I'll donate all $0.30 then: it's not a lot, but I guess it's better than nothing!
Persuader: To us it isn't much. To the children it means an awful lot. God Bless You for your donation!
	Persuadee: I guess you're right. Thanks so much for introducing me to the charity. Have a great day Maria!! :)

data:
Persuader: Hi! Do you have kids?
	Persuadee: I do. 2 of them. Do you?
Persuader: Not yet but one day! Have you ever heard of Save the Children>
	Persuadee: I might have. I am not sure. Why?
Persuader: I am a member of STC myself and hope to inform you of how great our organization is!
	Persuadee: Oh nice. Please do. 
Persuader: STC is an international organization promoting children's rights, especially children in developing countries. Have you ever done a mission trip or vocational trip to a third world country?
	Persuadee: Oh I have not. I think people that do are very interesting. Have you? 
Persuader: Not yet but I am traveling to Uganda with STC in March! Have you ever wanted to do something like that?
	Persuadee: It would be quite exciting I bet. What will you do when you get there? 
Persuader: We will be setting up a pseudo- children's hospital. More like a nurses station to help sick kiddos in remote villages.
	Persuadee: That's awesome. I bet they can use the help.
Persuader: They definitely can! And you can help, too!
	Persuadee: How could I do that?
Persuader: By supporting STC! Would you like to learn how?
	Persuadee: Sure. I would like that.
Persuader: There is no such thing as a small donation. If you'd be willing, you could donate some or all of your incoming payment for this task to STC! It'd be nothing more than a bag of chips at the store. Less than, even!
	Persuadee: How about .50. Will that be ok?
Persuader: That would be amazing! The research team will collect all donations and send them to STC. I am so appreciative!
	Persuadee: Wonderful. Thanks for the info.

Persuader: Excellent! We can finish now.  So, a dollar from you and me is a deal?

Persuader: Good morning! How are you today?
	Persuadee: I'm great, how are you?
Persuader: Doing well, thanks :)  I'm waiting on a plumber to come fix my washer drain. It flooded the basement 0.0
	Persuadee: I am sorry to hear that, my sister's car has to go in the shop too. Repairs suck.
Persuader: Yes they do. My husband would say we should just be grateful we have a machine and indoor plumbing to fix. Lol he's like that, gotta love him ;)
	Persuadee: That's sweet, you have a husband to help you. I am by myself. 
Persuader: I am lucky, I know it. Hubby would say, First World problems. Lol and he's right. That's what interested me in the option to donate part of what I make to Save The Children.
	Persuadee: How often do you donate?
Persuader: No set schedule, just whenever its offered here.The research team collects all donations and sends it for me. It's not a lot at once, but it adds up. 
	Persuadee: That's amazing, how much do you donate?
Persuader: Unless I'm saving up for something urgent, 100%. I'll scale it down or skip a donation if I feel I need to. But usually it's such a little bite, it doesn't hurt ;)
	Persuadee: You seem like a great person to be so charitable.
Persuader: That's very sweet of you to say, but it's easy to be generous when all the hard parts are handled for you. They take the donation directly from your task payment, so there's no red tape or MATH involved LOL!
	Persuadee: That seems easy enough and convenient. 
Persuader: Yes, and it makes me feel like I'm doing something just a little more worthwhile with my online time. 
	Persuadee: I think it's  a great cause. 
Persuader: If you are interested, here\'s the link to the charity:   URL    You "sign up" by just stating right here in chat what amount you would like to donate, from $0 to all your payment ($2 in this case, for me anyway). That\'s how I got started. 
	Persuadee: Thanks for the information, I would be happy to donate.
Persuader: Great! Just be sure to state the amount of your donation before we stop chatting, so the research team will see it.  
	Persuadee: I would like to donate ten cents.
Persuader: Great! Just be sure to state the amount of your donation before we stop chatting, so the research team will see it.

Persuader: Your donation is essential to help ensuring children's rights to health, education, safety, etc. Your donation will make a tangible impact for the children
	Persuadee: that's great! what percent of donations actually go to the children?
Persuader: 86% goes to program services for the children, 9% goes to fundraising for them, and 5% goes to general management

Persuader: Hello. How are you today?
	Persuadee: I am great how are you?
Persuader: I am doing okay. Enjoying this long weekend. Have you done anything fun over the weekend?
	Persuadee: Yes I did my first 5K Marathon to benefit ALS. What about you?
Persuader: Wow. That is awesome. I did my first 5k last year and I really want to do another one. I have been at home this weekend taking care of my newborn. Do you have any children?
	Persuadee: Yes but they are grown, I am with my Grandsons today.  All of three of them.
Persuader: How wonderful. Kids and family make life great. Have you ever heard of Save the Children?
	Persuadee: I have, is that what you did the Marathon for.
Persuader: No, actually I did run for the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation. But the Save the Children is another great organization that does a lot to help kids. Would you consider making a donation?
	Persuadee: Not at this time because I just did a donation to ALS yesterday, maybe another time.
Persuader: Well do you mind if I tell you a little bit more about the foundation?
	Persuadee: Sure go ahead.
Persuader: What a lot of people don't realize is how much they do. They help kids all of the world, including the US. They help with nutrition and education and safety. Sometimes it is easy to forget how wonderful it is to have you basic needs met without worry. 
	Persuadee: I'm sure they are very good, just that I'm spent out right now, that's why I do Amazon turk to earn a little extra money.
Persuader: I totally get it. That's why I do it too, to help with all of the extras. But what we sometimes forget is that a little can do a lot. Could you even spare 10 cents, less then you would spend on a can of coke?
	Persuadee: I don't drink soda can't afford it just water, but not today thank you, hope you have a good day though.
Persuader: Well i hope you enjoy the day with your grandsons and in the future you think about donating.
	Persuadee: Thank you enjoy your Newborn, and have a great day, goodbye
Persuader: Thank you. She sure is a blessing and her health is a gift.
	Persuadee: Enjoy, they are precious, Nice talking to you.

Persuader: Hello. You know what is a great charity? Save the Children.
	Persuadee: Really, well can you tell me more about this charity?
Persuader: Sure. They work to help children around the world. 
	Persuadee: How exactly do they help the children around the world? Education, Food, Medicine, etc.
Persuader: They promote children's rights. They provide emergency relief. They also provide food and other resources to children in developing nations.
	Persuadee: That sounds wonderful! Have you checked out how much of each $ goes directly to the children? Like how much does admin cost? 
Persuader: They are rated very highly on Charity Navigator for transparency and efficiency. Over 88 cents on the dollar goes directly to help children.
	Persuadee: That is a high percent. I am just a bit worried about donating to charities. I donated every month for years to United Way, until the admin was arrested for embezzling!!!
Persuader: That's a very reasonable concern. Save the Children has been helping kids for nearly 100 years. They are one of the most trusted charities in the world. 
	Persuadee: I also like to donate to local charities; Loaves and Fishes, Good Will, and Salvation Army. 
Persuader: Those are all great causes. One great thing about Save the Children is their international scope. For example, millions of Syrian children with a constant threat of violence. That is a crisis that requires an international solution.
	Persuadee: Agreed. Well I would like to donate 1.00.
Persuader: How much do you like to donate to the charity now? Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment ($2).
	Persuadee: I would like to donate $1.00 to Save the Children.
Persuader: That's wonderful and generous. That money which is relatively inconsequential will help tremendously.
	Persuadee: I am pleased to see that it will help. 
Persuader: Thank you again for helping. For more information visit  URL 
	Persuadee: Sure thing. Have a great day!
Persuader: How do we finish?
	Persuadee: LOL... I have no idea; and was just thinking the same myself.
Persuader: Ok. That did it. Have a good one.

Persuader: Hello, how's your Labor Day going?
	Persuadee: I had to work how bout you?
Persuader: Aw that's unfortunate to hear. I spent the day with my son and just finished dinner, now it's back to turking heh.
	Persuadee: I took a break and cleaned house and mowed, gonna turk till time to feed cows and horses.
Persuader: I love horses! Their so majestic and beautiful, do you have many?
	Persuadee: I have 2 minis they are only 37 inches tall.
Persuader: Oh no way minis!!!! They're so adorable! I bet they're a lot of work to take care of though right?
	Persuadee: No more than big ones really not as much.
Persuader: I guess they probably eat less than the big horses too then right?
	Persuadee: Yes thank goodness I have mini cows too. I am a little worried. A few counties over from us a big cat either a cougar or panther killed 3 horses and 2 dogs night before last.
Persuader: Oh wow that's pretty bad. Aside from keeping em in their barn or enclosure at night is there much you can do to prepare for that?
	Persuadee: A good fence, have them close to the house and a donkey for protection.
Persuader: Huh, donkeys must be pretty tough then I guess, never would have imagined that.
	Persuadee: Yes very good protector for and herd. They will kill a predator in a heartbeat.
Persuader: Well that's something I never would have considered. Hey have you ever heard of a organization called Save the Children?
	Persuadee: Yes, when my husband had a better job we sponsored a little boy for about 2 years.
Persuader: Oh wow! That's wonderful to hear, well I wanted to let you know this HIT allows us to donate a portion of our tasks payment directly to the organization!
	Persuadee: Yes I saw that. I would love to but haven't worked as much this month due to health reasons and I have a lot to make up. I am paying a car payment with my turk money. My old one was on it's last legs.
Persuader: I can understand that, if I told you I'd match your donation would you be able to donate just a small portion perhaps? I try to always donate even just a small amount for the suffering kid's sake.
	Persuadee: I may could .25 I know thats not much.

	Persuadee: Hello

	Persuadee: Yes, there is much more. When there is so much going on in the US in regards to government neglect, it is difficult to think about the struggles of the third world countries.

I believe more people would be willing to help others if given more "options\' for doing so. Asking for money "donations" is great but it definitely has yet to solve the issues going on in the world today! 
Persuader: It has been good to talk to you. I hope you will think about helping today.

data:
Persuader: Hi! Thanks for participating. Would you like to donate some of what you'll earn from this task to an awesome charity called Save the Children?
	Persuadee: Hi! Can you please tell me a bit about this charity?
Persuader: Sure. It's an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
	Persuadee: That sounds great. I don't know how much I am able to give right now.  
Persuader: Well, since you are earning money from this hit, you would be able to donate any or all of it. 
	Persuadee: Technically I could, but what difference would donating $2 make?
Persuader: Every little bit helps. There are 127 of these hits available. If each person donated $2, it would be $256, ahich would be great.
	Persuadee: That's a good point.  Do you know how much money goes to the children vs. paying people's salaries?
Persuader: Yes! In 2017, 86% of all expenditures went to program services. 9% went to fundraising and only 5% went to management.
	Persuadee: Thank you for that information. That is very helpful. I am happy to hear so much goes to program services.
Persuader: So, how much would you like to donate to the charity? Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment. Any amount would be very appreciated, but of course, the more the better, lol.
	Persuadee: How much do you think I should donate today? What would you do if you were me?
Persuader: Well, I feel that this is a very important cause. I mean, who doesn't want to support a charity that provides disaster relief, and feeds  starving children, and helps care for refugees? If it were me, I would donate the entire $2. To us, it's not much, but to them it means a lot. 
	Persuadee: Well, unfortunately I need all the money I can get these days.  I will donate some but I can't donate all of it.
Persuader: Okay, I totally understand. I'm in the same boat, which is why I work so hard on MTurk! How about $1.50 ? Some for you and some for the children.. 
	Persuadee: I still think that's a bit more than I can go right now. I do plan on donating independently when things are better.
Persuader: That's great. I try to donate when I can as well. Sometimes I decide to give up some small indulgences like the Dunkin Donuts iced coffee I love just so I can have some to give to those that are less fortunate. Do you think you might be able to skip a cup of coffee or a snack this week to help these kids? It sounds like you'd really like to donate. Think of how good it would make you feel to know you've helped someone today.
	Persuadee: Yes it would make me feel good. I already skip all of those things. I've been skipping paying some bills unfortunately too. It's a hard decision.  I was thinking $1.00,
Persuader: $1.00 would be awesome! You seem like a great person who is really concerned about others. If you commit to that now, the research team will collect it and send it to Save the Children. 
	Persuadee: Thank you for convincing me! I commit to donating $1 to Save the Children.
Persuader: Thank you so much! Have a wonderful day.
	Persuadee: Thank you. I hope you have a great day too!

Persuader: Hello. How are you today?
	Persuadee: I am good. How are you?
Persuader: I am fantastic. Thank you for asking. 
	Persuadee: I'm glad. Are you from the States?
Persuader: I am. Actually a teacher in the states. What about you what do you do for a living?
	Persuadee: I work in Car sales
Persuader: Oh yea? Does that make a great impact on the peoples lives ?
	Persuadee: It can, not like a teacher can, but if a person buys a car that they absolutely love, they leave happy and excited
Persuader: Always good to make somone excited. Can even vastly improve on their lives. Ever felt bad for someone who couldn't afford the car you were trying to sell, but knew they really needed one?
	Persuadee: yes, I do, but most of the time, people come in and say this is what I can afford? Can I get this and if I say no, but you could get this, they are generally happy. Do you teach young kids or older kids?
Persuader: I currently teach young kids. Mostly in urban communities who are low income and in need of good caring teachers. Keeping them off the streets and such. Most usually need some sort of help. What kind of area do you work in?
	Persuadee: I work in a rural area...Most of where I live in rural and country, lol. Its kinda like the urban kids...people think just because we are country we are bumpkins but we really arent. I bet the kids you teach are thankful for good teachers like you
Persuader: But of course they love me. Kids in different areas are still kids lol. Urban and rural both have their challenges. Have you ever helped kids or is their little time for that?
	Persuadee: I try to as much as I can. I have two that I\'ve "adopted" because their parents chose drugs over them and I spend as much time with them as I can
Persuader: Oh so you know all about helping already. We need people who adopt and take care of those who were abandoned. Ever donated to one of those save the kids charities?
	Persuadee: no I haven't. I prefer to spend time mentoring over monatary donations
Persuader: I'm the same way. However, every bit helps especially when I am so busy mentoring the kids after school. Sometimes, I just throw a dollar or 2 out to help a kid get some food or a snack. Heck just to reward them for not hanging around the rough streets with the drugs. 
	Persuadee: well yeah I've done that but not donated to a charitable organization
Persuader: Hypothetical... if you could give a kid a dollar or 2 right now for some food to eat.. even for one meal.. would you?
	Persuadee: yes I would...kids should never go hungry for any reason, its not their fault if their parents can't afford to feed them or what not. would you do the same
Persuader: Of course and I alway do lol. I can give the chance to do so right now if you would like?
	Persuadee: If I was to donate a $1 would you match it?
Persuader: I sure would. 
	Persuadee: Than we have reached a donation agreement true?
Persuader: Sounds about right. Mind if it is deducted from your task payment?
	Persuadee: I absolutely do not mind at all
Persuader: Alright then a donation of 1$ will be deducted from your task payment. I am sure you have just made a child day.. once again.

data:
Persuader: Good morning, how are you doing today?
	Persuadee: I'm doing well. How are you doing? It is a beautiful morning where I am at.
Persuader: It is definitely a beautiful morning.  A great day to be out volunteering for a cause.  I am headed out to do some community work today.
	Persuadee: Oh that is really nice. What type of cause are you in?
Persuader: I have been working with a group called Save the Children for a few years now.
	Persuadee: Wow that is wonderful. I have a passion for helping children also. As a current nursing student, my goal is to become a neonatal nurse or pediatric nurse. Children in this world is very important because they are so vulnerable and they are the future of this world.
Persuader: I couldn't agree more.  I work with children primarily from underprivileged families or no families at all.
	Persuadee: That is wonderful, whenever there are charity events or donations being taken. I always donate if it is for children causes. What about you?
Persuader: I do the same but also get involved regularly.  Today, for instance, is our End of Summer Carnival for the kids.  Its one of our largest fundraisers of the year.
	Persuadee: Wow, that sounds really fun. Time and money donations are really two important aspects for charities. Without the funding, it would not be able to continue and without volunteers, no one can do the actual work.  
Persuader: I know this may seem a bit forward and I do apologize as I do not mean to offend.  Given your love for children and your work, would you be willing to donate a small amount to Save the Children?
	Persuadee: yes I would be honored to. Since I am a nursing student and paying for tuition out of pocket, my donation amount may not be too great but I would like to donate something. So I like to donate $5 to the cause
Persuader: Wow thats great but for the sake of formality, I must ask the obligatory legal fashion: "How much do you like to donate to the charity now? Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment." 
	Persuadee: Oh, ok. I like to donate $1
Persuader: You are such a blessed partner in our cause! Thank you so much! The research team will collect all donations and send it to Save the Children."
	Persuadee: You are very welcome! So glad to help
Persuader: The children will most certainly benefit from large donations such as yours.
	Persuadee: Its a joy to help. Thank you for donating your time to the cause. 
Persuader: Well I should be getting off here soon.  The beautiful day outside is calling for me and the carnival starts soon.  Again, it was a pleasure meeting you and many many thanks for your kind generosity in the form of a donation. I will tell everyone about you today!
	Persuadee: Pleasure meeting you too! Hope you have lots of fun at the carnival!

data:
Persuader: Hello, may I ask you a question?
	Persuadee: Hi there, yep fire away
Persuader: Do you like children?
	Persuadee: I do like children. I have 3 of my own
Persuader: That's a blessing. may I ask you another question?
	Persuadee: please ask away
Persuader: How would you feel if your children were sick and you had no way to help them because of lack of money?
	Persuadee: I would feel horrible. I would do all that I could to try and fix that situation
Persuader: That is a noble sentiment. You are truly blessed to have healthy children. But unfortunately not everyone is so blessed and their are countless children suffering from the very things that make you feel horrible. But what if I told you that you can do something to fix that, how would you respond?
	Persuadee: I am aware of others suffering in the world. I would be interested in what can be done to fix the situation.
Persuader: That is good to hear, and I indeed have great news for you, for today you can help. Have you ever heard of Save the Children NGO?
	Persuadee: I have not heard of Save the Children NGO. What do they do?
Persuader: The long short of it is they provide a way for the severely underprivileged and unrepresented children in this world with a fighting chance to make it to adult hood, something we take for granted sometimes.  For detailed information you can visit their website at  URL   But while I have your attention can I ask you for your help now.  If you donate anywhere up to two dollars you will have made and immeasurable improvement on these young souls.
	Persuadee: I can help. I'd be willing to donate $1 to save the children
Persuader: That is fantastic news. So  I can confirm your agreement of a donation of one dollar to Save the Children?
	Persuadee: yes. you can confirm
Persuader: You are the reason I do this. Many sincere thanks. Would you like instructions now for donating?
	Persuadee: sure please send them
Persuader: The research team will collect all donations and send it to Save the Children. So keep an eye out for the team. A million thanks from a million little ones.
	Persuadee: wonderful. I am glad i could help.

Persuader: Hi, how are you today?
	Persuadee: I am fine. And you?
Persuader: Not too bad :) Have you heard of Save The Children?
	Persuadee: I have, actually.
Persuader: They do greeat work at least I think what about you?
	Persuadee: I'm often skeptical of big charities like that. They sometimes don't put the money that is donated into the right projects.
Persuader: I know normally I am too but I was convinced to research them once by a very giving friend and I found that they do a lot of awesome work and a big majority if not all donations go back into the charity and lining someones pocket
	Persuadee: I have just done some quick research and am inclined to donate when I have the opportunity. If a charity is doing good work to feed the hungry, I will give what I have to spare.
Persuader: hehe, I meant rather then lining someones pocket....So do I have your commitment to donating some today at the end of the HIT?
	Persuadee: I don't really have anything to give right now, but I will donate at another time when I have steady income.
Persuader: They give you an option at the end of the HIT to donate even 0.01 would be very helpful....a penny couldn't hurt could it?
	Persuadee: I suppose not. I mean, a penny is nothing in the grand scheme of things. If I have a chance to donate when I'm a bit more financially stable, I will donate more. Right now, I think I can spare a penny. :)
Persuader: Good, and I'll match and times it by five and now we'll have donated 0.06
	Persuadee: Alright. Will the penny be taken from my mturk account? That would be the most convenient thing for me.

	Persuadee: Well, thank you for wishing me well. May your days be pleasant, as well.
Persuader: how's the weather?

data:
Persuader: Hi WOuld you like to donate your payment for this task to save the children?
	Persuadee: No, to be honest I am doing this task to save up extra money for myself.
Persuader: I understand that. But it's only .30 of the money you are saving. It could do alot of good for Save the children.
	Persuadee: I appreciate your position, but what exactly is Save the Children and how do I know that money will truly be used to help kids?
Persuader: The researchers of this hit will make sure the money goes to save the children. Save the Children is a world wide organization that helps kids in war torn areas.
	Persuadee: It sounds like a good idea, but I often get peppered with requests to donate money to various charities -- when I donate I do it to causes that I know about.  If I donated to every cause I would be giving away a lot of money and I already lose 20% to taxes.
Persuader: Your right, but I'm not asking for much. It's only .30 cents and It will do alot to help.
	Persuadee: What exactly would that 30 cents be used for and how would it help?  What part of the world will it go to?
Persuader: It would go all over the world! The money is used to promote childrens rights and provide food and medicine.
	Persuadee: I have to respectfully question the necessity -- don't my taxes already go towards billions of dollars of foreign aid?  And why do so many of these countries continually need help?
Persuader: Well, lets get specific. Have you seen the kids in Syria?
	Persuadee: I have seen some of the images and video of the civil war there.
Persuader: Those kids are growing up in tents and being bombed every day.
	Persuadee: True -- but how much money is currently being provided by US and NATO to help?
Persuader: They have provided the tents. Still it isn't enough. The kids there are struggling. 
	Persuadee: I have to question that they have provided only tents.  Many countries have absorbed many refugees and I am fairly certain that way more aid than tents has been provided.
Persuader: True, but there - the kids are lucky to get a meal a day. Save the children helps with that.
	Persuadee: It may -- but at this point I really still have no idea what Save the Children is and I would want to research it anyway before I would agree to give money to it.
Persuader: I think thats a good idea. 
	Persuadee: Additionally, I am just very skeptical of any organization that asks for money.  I never know who is in charge, who is taking what, and where the money truly goes.

data:
Persuader: Hello friend  how are you today?
	Persuadee: i'm okay, how are you?
Persuader: I am great thanks for asking. I am here to bring awareness to a great charity. Are you interested in hearing about it?
	Persuadee: sure, lets hear it. I'm all about charity 
Persuader: Thats great well that charity is called Save the Children. Have you ever heard about it before?
	Persuadee: i haven't, can you tell me about it
Persuader: Sure it is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries. 
	Persuadee: sounds very worthwhile, what kind of relief goes to the children
Persuader: Relief includes food shelter education and safety. Are you interested in helping children achieve these important things?
	Persuadee: how much of the donation goes straight to the relief
Persuader: 86 percent of the donation actually goes to helping the children. 9 percent gets reinvested into marketing for the charity at 5 percent into miscellaneous expenses.  As you can see much of the donation will go to helping these poor children. 
	Persuadee: id be willing to donate .15 to the charity
Persuader: Wow that is a very kind gesture. This money would be collected from research team and they will send it to Save the Children
	Persuadee: okay thank you for that information, are you also going to donate?
Persuader: Yes I plan on it. It warms my heart to bring a relief to children. Can you believe in this day and age children are still suffering?
	Persuadee: i can believe it, but that certainly doesn't mean it should continue. children are the last people that deserve any of this kind of life
Persuader: I agree. There are millions of Syrian children that have grown up facing daily threat of violence. It needs to stop and hopefully Save the Children is an effort that can help. 
	Persuadee: if i could do anything in the world it would be peace, and that would be the first place id start, those poor children
Persuader: As Whitney Houston once said  "I believe the children are our future  Teach them well and let them lead the way." No truer words have been spoken. Thanks again for your donation and sleep well knowing you did something to help.  
	Persuadee: thank you as well, the more people who get involved the better
